name: Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.text: We stayed at the Rio Mar for a business conference Mar 15-22, 2008. Overall a very nice resort. Staff is friendly and accomodating and they always greet you with a smile. Service at the beach bar a little slow during peak times. Food very good but overpriced. For a good meal, take the cab ($20.00 round trip) to Don Pepe. Some days it was hard to find a lounger by the pool as many people have reserved with towels early. Nice long, not crowded beach. Walk the beach to the right of the ocean and there is a private, uninhabited area with a lagoon of water with rainforest in background. Just beautiful. Beach was closed for three days while we were there (high tidal waves) but on the days it was open, it was great for finding shells - especially sand dollars (found at least a dozen of those). We stayed in East wing, kind of a far walk to the ball rooms but good exercise. Housekeeping is good. Front desk is responsive to needs. Only disappointment was that we requested a king size bed and had two doubles. Not too romantic! The hotel was booked and they don't have many king rooms, so they weren't able to switch us. Iguan feeding at 11am daily is cool. Food is good, nice variety but very expensive. We recommend you take a cab to an authentic PR restaurant. Great pina coladas and other frozen drinks at Rio Mar, but priced at $10-12 each.
reviews.title: Very nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at the Copamarina and the El San Juan, this hotel had quite a different feel--all three did in fact. The hotel is very grand and sprawling, but it feels a bit impersonal and cold. The room was spotless and not a complaint could I make. The grounds are lush and gorgeous. The beach is very nice and well-kept--ie the sweep the seaweed away from where people sit. The pools are gorgeous and very, very well-kept. They are hosed off every morning and regularly cleaned and maintained from any debris that gets blown into them during the day.
reviews.title: So big and a bit impersonal...

likes.liked: — I appreciated the cleanliness and care taken of the hotel--it was TOP NOTCH.
likes.disliked: — It is a big hotel, so it's a bit impersonal. Also dining options are limited and are expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are limited dining options here. In fact, 2 of the restaurants were not even open when we were there. We ate at "The Palm" -- the steakhouse at the golf club one night--it was expensive for the portion that you get, but still a nice meal. And we went 'off-'campus' to a local restaurant another night. The breakfast/lunch restaurant is nice, lower key but expensive. What they don't tell you at breakfast is that a cup of coffee with no refill is $4, but if you buy the pot of coffee, that's $7. The buffet looked beautiful, but it was just too pricey to tempt our palate. You really don't have much of a choice however unless you're willing to hop in the car and drive to Luquillo or somewhere else--but who really wants to do that if you just want to sit poolside and relax? Our fave find was the gelato in the Italian pizzeria.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay!! Save money and go local to eat

reviews.text: My husband was originally scheduled to play golf there at the resort, hence the reason for us staying there, but it was just too windy while we were there and spending $175 for a round of golf that was not going to have optimal playing conditions is hard to justify. I turned down a massage at the spa for price reason alone.
reviews.title: Great services, relaxing vacation
very good expirience at richies
reviews.text: What is great is the proximity to El Yunque. We spend a lovely day hiking there. Note that some of the trails are not well-marked, so it's a good idea to ask someone.

Just returned from a 5 night stay at The Westin Rio Mar Resort. We stayed here a few years ago. The hotel is nicely situated and has lovely grounds. Very relaxed atmosphere and generally staff were pleasant and motivated to please.The large stretch of beach, this property fronts is lovely. The water was clean and inviting. Yes, I do agree with some of the negatives regarding the limited, expensive food choices, but we made the best of it. We remembered this issue from our prior stay,but we wanted to give it another try-hoping for some inprovement. I must note that we stayed our last two nights at The Ritz Carlton, near Old San Juan area.Surprisingly, we preferred the Westin due to what we valued as important for our vacation stay. We liked the idea of being away from the city-more importantly-the airport.(the sound of airplanes/smell of fuel was disturbing) It was nice to just relax and not feel that we had to leave the property to dine. Some dinners were dissapppointing-but some were very good and enjoyable-despite the expense. We have stayed at other resorts where the meals were at least equal or more costly so we were not shocked. If you truly like to be out and about and have access to the nightlfe of Old San Juan area, then yes staying here might not be the best choice. But if you are looking for a relaxing beach resort experience without the need to have something to do every night then this might be what you are looking for. We did do a one day shopping/lunch in Old San Juan-which was enough for us.Some more adventurous people visit the Rain Forest nearby. The Casino is small(in comparision to the one at The Ritz) but adequate. They have a David's Cookies that has ice cream, cookies, desserts, and coffee. In the morning you can get coffee/ muffin for low cost breakfast. We mostly ate at the bar area which had a very nice delux continental breakfast for $15.00 including tax/gratuities. Thought this was a great deal and very good. Dinner at their main dinning room, Meres was very good. Lunch at Coqui was good-but do avoid dinner there. We ate twice at the Italian restaurant-Palio-which was very good. Service tends to be slower than what you would expect or hope for, but found that to be the tendency. I do have to say, though that the pleasant and accommodating staff made up for the slow service at times. We enjoyed our stay at the Westin and would return. Just need to know what you are looking for. Please email me with any questions.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, lovely beach and relaxed atmosphere...
Very disappointing
reviews.text: I stayed at the Rio last month and coudlnt believe this is classified as a "Westin." This is further from the Westin than I hope to ever experience again. Other than the fact that the resort is extremely isolated, the resort iteself has its serious pitfalls. We had one out of four days where our room was not made up. Friends of ours had 3 out of 4 days without their room being made up. And no they didnt spend theirs days in the room. We were up and out of our room by 10am only to return at 5pm to find the room as we left it.

reviews.title: Beware: They didn't honor my reservation! (and Conquistador is better)
reviews.text: Every restaurant is a rip off, and the food extremely disappointing. Unfortunately there is nowhere else nearby so you are forced to waste your money on what they offer. The concierge sent us by shuttle to a restaurant slightly away from the main hotel. Only to arrive there and after waiting for 15mins they told us the restaurant was fully booked! No organization within the hotel. We saw this pattern over and over again.

We rented a car from Avis who has an office on site. A $5 per day parking rate was offered due to the rental car, and when I reminded the front desk agent about the discount she was nothing but rude and demeaning and refused to budge. Overall the lack of customer service is really frustrating and extremely disappointing.
reviews.title: Would never go again

likes.disliked: — price of food and room location

reviews.text: I would advise you to pick somewhere else.
reviews.title: Nice but a little isolated

likes.liked: — The location of the hotel was a bit isolated.

reviews.text: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Rio Mar. Great hotel! Check in was fast and easy. The staff very courteous and friendly. They had upgraded our room to an oceanfront instead of a gardenview. Wonderful! The hotel was extreamely clean and well maintaned. The landscaping was perfect with flowering shrubs, and palm trees. The large beach is very nice with plenty of umbrellas and chairs available for hotel guests. They even have bar service right on the beach. Great free-form pools and nice hot tubs. Nice outdoor restaurant for lunch or snack right by the pool. We had supper at Marbella restaurant the first nignt. It was very good. The food and drinks were a bit pricy at this hotel, but that is to be expected at a place of this caliber. There is a bakery/ pizza shop a mile down from the hotel that serves breakfast for just a few dollars. Try Ritchie's for dinner. They are located up on the hill behind the hotel. If you want a reasonable, really good dinner, Don Pepe's is the place to go. The hotel had a very nice gift shop with good variety.Reading some of the other reviews, I really don't understand what some people expect. I have travelled to several places in the world, and I have been to many top class hotels. This is one of the best hotels I have been to. You should rent a car, though. The hotel is a good distance from San Juan or any other sizable city.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: My family just returned from a week at the Rio Mar Beach Resort. It was a great resort for families and included an on-site "kids camp" (for kids ages 4 and up), babysitters available, a playground and daily activities. Given that I was traveling with two young children, it was the perfect environment for my family. Note that there was not excessive programming (like you would find at Beaches, Club Med, or on a cruise). The property was beautiful and the staff was very attentive and pleasant. I cannot say enough good things about the staff. They pre-arranged restaurant reservations, babysitting, and spa services for me and throughout my stay were incredibly diligent and thorough. That said, the rooms were average, and I was highly disappointed to find that the "partial ocean view" that I booked required me to go out onto my balcony to actually see the ocean. There were two pools - a quiet pool and an activity pool - both pools were good but the beach was just ok. I didn't think it was as rough as other people had commented, though it wasn't as placid as other Caribbean islands. The food was good but expensive; given the family-friendly nature of the hotel, children were present at all of the restaurants. The Grille Room was particularly good, as was Palio. The spa was way overpriced. There were daily rainshowers and I couldn't tell if we were just there during the rainy season or if it's like this all of the time (because the hotel is right by the rainforest.
reviews.title: Family friendly resort

likes.disliked: — They could have refined a few things; rooms were just average, spa was overpriced, etc...

reviews.text: Bottom line: Puerto Rico is an easy destination from most cities, transportation to the hotel from the airport is easy, and it is a great hotel for anybody wanting a nice venue where you can go with young children.
reviews.title: Not my scene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was here for a conference so didn't choose it, but I was looking forward to the beach and some winter sun. The hotel is set in fine grounds with attractive pools and a long sandy beach. However, the sea was very rough and it was not possible to swim in the sea. My main gripe is over the rooms. They are a good size but have two large beds which take up all the room. One king bed and arm chairs would be preferable. The first room I was given was at the back overlooking an ugly roof with loud noise from the air conditioning system. I asked for a move which was arranged after asking three times and was given a room with partial sea view. The air conditioning only blew ice cold air keeping the room at about 62 degrees so I had to turn it off as despite my complaining nothing was done. It was so cold at first that when I opened the door to the balcony the whole room was enveloped in condensation. The other problem was the lack of sound proofing between rooms, and I was kept awake one night until 2 am by next door's TV. All my colleagues were disappointed with their rooms at the back overlooking car parking or flat roof areas. Definitely make sure to book a sea facing room above the third floor.
reviews.title: Below average

likes.liked: — The fact that the hotel accepts pets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were pricey, especially for wine which had exorbitant mark-up, and the food in the Asian restaurant was disappointing, whilst the Palio Italian was good.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Beautiful resort with great service. Very nice rooms and bath. The only complaint is that our room was over the parking garage and we could hear cars coming in and out all night. The beach is beautiful and the pools great. We had delicious meals in the restaurants. A wonderful time was had by all!
reviews.title: A bit of paradise

reviews.text: My husband and I took our 18 year old son and his friend to the Rio Mar/Puerto Rico as a high school graduation present. The room was clean with a terrific view and the beds very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurants' food was good but expensive. There are many food options outside the resort and there is an excellent restaurant up the cliff from the resort called Richie's. The alcoholic drinks at any of the bars were very small and very expensive. We bought some beer from the outside and kept it on ice since the refrigerator was not working. It is best to rent a car giving you more flexibility but the hotel charges daily parking. The spa is very nice and relaxing. The golf courses were beautiful but expensive to use. The pools were not the cleanist and the staff had to be told several times to clean the scum accumulating near the steps of the "adult" pool. The beach was kept clean but you could not snorkel in the water since you can not see more than one foot in front of you. Nightlife is non-existent except for the casino. A nightclub with music would be nice. Overall, a very nice, quiet resort if you are looking for a relaxing vacation but be prepared to spend.
reviews.title: Rio Mar a beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I received a very low price from Wyndham to visit their resort and go to the 2 hour timeshare presentation. We accepted this offer and glad we did. Prior to going to Rio Mar, I read all the reviews on trip advisor. Some were very positive and some were very negative. So I hoped for the best and prepared for the worst. My conclusion to it all..... all the post are correct, but it depends on what your expectations are as to if you take a positive or negative experience away from the trip.
reviews.title: Depends on your expectaions

likes.liked: — friendly staff, quiet at night, chaise loungers under palm trees

reviews.text: My husband and I like to travel, but we travel on a budget. We typically stay somewhere low costs so we have money to spend on excursions.
reviews.title: Nice and frequent deals on price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is what I saw from the hotel.... no pro or cons, just facts:
reviews.title: LOVED the Rio Mar

reviews.text: The Good: the resort was in better condition than I expected based on some of the reviews on this site. Beautiful grounds, nice ammenities, food at the restaurants better than expected, satisfactory rooms, big bathrooms, wonderful beach area, lots of activity, excellent valet service.
reviews.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad: though there are many pool areas, they need to be cleaned more often. The water was oily feeling and murky. Maid service was erratic, room service food not that great. It's also a loud hotel and the room walls are paper thin. Lots of loud partying going on in other rooms and at the pools. I hate to say this but many of the hotel guests seemed sleazy.
reviews.title: Pricey Paradise

reviews.text: The Ugly: management at this hotel is nonexistant. We were initially given a room with one bed when we had requested two doubles. Downstairs desk said they'd be up to the room with new card keys for another room. They never came, even after 7 more calls down to the front desk, and even after another couple showed up at our room saying the room we were in had been given to them. So basically, we were roomless for another hour before the hotel finally corrected the situation. No apologies and when we asked to speak to the manager, he never contacted us.
reviews.title: great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall: not a bad place to stay but not a great one either. Truthfully, I wasn't that impressed with this resort or Puerto Rico in general. I'd suggest going to the Dominican Republic instead.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Rio Mar with my boyfriend from 7.11 to 7.14 and thought it was, overall, a fantastic place to stay. The resort is approximately an hour's drive from Old San Juan (taxi cost $70 without tip), a journey that offers views of everything from KFC to the mountains. Rio Mar is a few miles off the highway, and the resort itself (including the clubhouse and golf course) is so large that you "need" to board a shuttle to get to the more distant spots. The inside of the hotel is stunning: beautiful/spacious lobby, breathtaking views and well-appointed decor. Check-in was relatively easy, though I noticed at least 10 employees standing behind the row of desks and only one actively working with guests. (This was true of check-out, too, and I recommend checking out from your room by phone. You can leave your name and room number on a machine, and they check you out. The final bill is left under your door on the morning of your departure.)
reviews.title: Great Hotel..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at this hotel on a change of names was a little uneasy at first. Westin has a good reputation and wyndham does also, but it was taking over as we were there. Impressed when we arrived, nice hotel and friendly staff. Ded,Eli, and Rey at the lobby bar get thumbs up for service, and staff. Jose at coqui lounge, thanks for your hospitality. Angel at the tiki bar, never an empty glass. Check in and get a refrigerator when you get to the room. Stock it with whatever you drink. I'm not cheap but when you're in you're room it's worth it. Go to the gift shop if you don't get a car. They sell some beer and liquor, or go down a mile or so to the deli. Housekeeping was outstanding, room was perfect each day and night for turn down service. If you're lucky go to top floor on west side and see nice sunsets on balcony/patio. It might be changed after take over.
reviews.title: helpful hints and review

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Rio Mar with my fiancee. The grounds and the pool area are beautiful, but we were disappointed with a lot of things. As can be expected, the prices at the hotel restaurants are outrageous, and the food is nothing special. They know that you're 1 hour from San Juan and 30 minutes from other restaurants, so the prices are very high. The most disappointing part of our stay was the golf. We saved up and had our one big splurge on a round of golf at the Ocean Course (there is also a River Course, but there was a tournament going on when we were there). First of all, there is only one par 3 hole that is on the ocean - and it's surrounded by construction as they are building new condos all around it. The other 17 holes are no where near the ocean. And they didn't even tell us that they were seeding all of the greens, so we paid $150 per person for "green" fees even though the greens were perfectly brown and sandy with seed. It was very disappointing. Though the course may have been special back in the '80s when Greg Norman designed it, it is very run down and is not worth such a high green fee.
reviews.title: Beautiful pool area, but serious drawbacks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, if you want to lay by a nice pool and be on a nice beach, you will enjoy this hotel, but for anything besides that, I highly recommend that you rent a car and go explore the "real" Puerto Rico outside of the hotel compound.
reviews.title: Loved the resort, but the prices were high

reviews.text: We stayed at the resort June 18-22, just my husband and I, and we really had a great time! The room was very nice and clean, the grounds were kept clean and the hotels workers were always very friendly and helpful! The only downside we found was the price of the food. A pina colada, or the like, was $9, breakfast buffet was $24 a person(we never ate it b/c we thought the price was ridiculous), sandwich and fries was $13. We went to Old San Juan, El Yunque and Luquillo Beach while we were there and all were worth it!! I would say that we probably should've rented a car b/c taxi's were expensive! Overall it was a wonderful vacation at a great resort!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: The resort was beautiful, a bit expensive but if you catch a good sale -its worth it. The restaurants, bars and spa on site are pricey, but you can save lots of money on the tours by renting a car! The rainforest (El Yunique) is a free tour but the hotel charges $38 per person to take you there. El Yunique is directely up the "long mountain road" from the hotel. The hotel also offers a tour to Old San Juan which is $45 per person but they dont take you to the El Morro fort, it only goes to the forts by the shopping area. If you rent a car you can go throughout the entire tourist area and just pay for parking (much cheaper). Also, there's a great outlet mall about 20 minutes away from the hotel. The conceirge is very helpful with maps and directions so if you decide to rent a car - getting around shouldnt be a problem. I suggest you rent from the Avis car rental located at the resort because they'll give you free parking, otherwise parking is $15 a day for outside rentals. Also there's 2 really good spanish restaurants at the corner of highway #3 where the resort entrance is (Don Pepe & Antoniette's) their prices are way cheaper than anything in the resort. Also there's KFC's, Burger King's and other fast food places you can get to (if you have a car).Be sure to keep all your receipts charged to your room and review your bill before paying room charges. If your traveling with kids - the hotel feeds the iguanna's at 11am everyday for free - join in! The kids club is a bit a rip off, unless u really need a babysitter. Find a local liquor store and add alcohol to ur drinks at the beach. The spa was ok - but I've had better for cheaper. Sign up for" Wyndam By Request" and get extra perks such as late check out, free room upgrades, discounts to use at the resort, free snacks upon check in etc.
reviews.title: Loved Rio Mar

reviews.text: Visited this resort with 5 other families it was so disappointing for kids and adults. Not a very exciting pool, very small slide. One basketball hoop for the kids. One outside Tiki Bar with absolutely no entertainment not even a radio, staff SO unfriendly. Not an inviting beach and watersports ex: jet skiies, kayak,sailboats old and rundown. Rooms smelled and rundown looking,balcony paint chipped everywhere. We all could not find one positive thing about this so called resort. We checked out of the hotel after 3 days and moved to the El Conquistador Resort and all 5 families had a fantastic vacation!!!!
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: • Restaurants and bars
reviews.title: Nice resort but depends on your room location. Uneven staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Surprised and disappointed that none of the restaurants offered any local cuisine. Didn’t try all the restaurants but here’s my overview of those we did try.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: Marbella- Only ate breakfast there but very mediocre food in my opinion. The breakfast buffet was average in quality but with tax and tip comes to almost $30. A few times we ordered breakfast off the menu but it was rather uninspired and bland. Wait staff service was average to downright rude. Since it was busy with three convention groups they seemed harried and not at all friendly. One waiter complained to us that he was working so hard while the guests were having fun. One waitress was almost indignant that she had to bother with writing a bill for my breakfast (my husband had a voucher and I did not). She overcharged me and then billed me for his pot of coffee and refused to do anything about it when I questioned it. She claimed he overspent his voucher (he didn’t) put his coffee on my bill. I didn’t bother to ask for a manager (but did put it on my comment card) since we had already waited about 40 minutes just to get the check but she lost out on a tip.
reviews.title: Amazing, but beware....

likes.liked: — ambiance- beautiful hotel, good food, nice staff, great scenery
likes.disliked: — extra charges- parking, arcade, casino, hold on credit card

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Shimas- Good (not great) food. Service here was good. Large portions! I had half my lo mein put in a to-go box (love the fact that there was a small refrigerator in the room) and it was enough for both of us to have for lunch the next day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stay at the Rio Mar from April 20th - 25th. We arrived late at night and was happy to see that the front desk staff had already made up our keys, maps, etc for our arrival. (We got a great upgrade to an ocean view suite).
reviews.title: Very nice stay....
Great relaxing place
reviews.text: We opted for the self-serve parking ($15/day) instead of the valet and that worked out great....a bit of inconvience to go to the valet desk to validate our parking ticket everytime you leave the hotel garage.

Room was nice. Large comfortable room with a real nice balcony with table and chairs....great for enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning. Housekeeping did a great job everyday and we got turn-down service everynight.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach was great. Seas were NOT rough at all. I've seen much bigger waves in Rhode Island....nothing to worry about here. Always lots of chairs and umbrellas available all day long. Pool (adult) also nice...quiet in contrast to the kids pool which got pretty crazy at times....lots of kids at the resort the week we were there.
reviews.title: 4 "carribean stars"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ate at the resort one day at Aqua Luna.....pretty good seafood, not a huge menu. But excellent service and good wine list. (~ $120 for 2).
reviews.title: Unforgettable pleasant stay

reviews.text: My wife and 2 daughters (12 and 15) just returned from a one week stay at the Westin. We were a little nervous staying at the Westin as the reviews are so mixed. Overall we had a great time and enjoyed the hotel. We were debating between the Caribe Hilton and the El Conquistador. We were very happy with our choice. We booked the hotel
reviews.title: Had a great Vacation in Puerto Rico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: by calling the Westin and were given the lowest rate with AAA over the phone. It was 278 for ocean view per night plus taxes and resort fees. As mentioned earlier the resort fees are expensive so the room was about 340 per night with the extras. Yes the resort is remote so I would strongly recommend getting a car at the airport otherwise you
reviews.title: Wonderful Long Weekend - Great Hotel!

reviews.text: are stuck on the property. We parked each night in the employee lot accross from the main lot and this was free otherwise parking was 15 per night.
reviews.title: Okay. Just okay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked one room for the four of us with two double beds and balcony. The room was clean and about average size. The view was toward the ocean but you really had to be on the balcony to see the ocean. We tried to upgrade as we are Starwood Gold but the hotel was overbooked and we could not move. I think we could have moved the next day but my kids were settled in so I did not try. The bedding was nice but the beds were not like the heavenly beds at other Westins. They were OK but not nearly as nice as the normal heavenly beds. The bathroom was nothing special with only one sink and tub shower combo with adequate hot water and water pressure. The housekeeping was fine and the room was kept clean each day. We did have a rollaway brought in as our kids don't like to sleep together so it was a little cramped and they also brought a small refrigerator
reviews.title: Save your money!

likes.disliked: — noisy hotel rooms not as described

reviews.text: which was nice to keep beer and soda to take to the beach. There was no charge for the frig or the extra bed. The TV was 27 inches with an OK selection of channels but no movie channels.
reviews.title: Great family vacation

likes.liked: — Beautiful beach and grounds, incredible views

reviews.text: This is s a wonderful resort property on the oceanfront, about 1 hour drive from San Juan Airport, and just a short drive to the El Yunque rainforest. The service is excellent and the staff friendly. There is great golf, tennis, two pools (one with a kiddie slide, and the other long enough to swim laps), spa, casino, in room internet and cable, beach and watersport activities. The restaurants are all top quality, although a bit pricey. They do nickel and dime you on fees (ie daily parking fee, resort fee, housekeeping fee), but if you get an offseason or mid week room rate you still get terrific value. There is an airport shuttle, and day tours available, but it helps to have a car to get out and explore the island.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked the proximity to smaller towns outside of the traffic and congestion of San Juan. There are less expensive dining options in nearby Luquillo and Fajardo, and you must visit the famous kiosks near the Luquillo Beach exit (only 10 minutes away) for inexpensive home cooked foods. It may look a little intimidating to the nervous traveler hoping to eat at a gleaming US eatery, but I found them friendly, inviting and very casual.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!

reviews.text: If you are travelling with children, you will want to visit the famous Luquillo beach . For the $3 parking fee, there are restrooms , shady picnic areas, and one of the best beaches on the island. If you are single, you can venture to the same beach by parking behind the kiosks for free, then walk 30 yards over to the kiosks for a cold beer and snacks when you need them. I was there mid week: there were no crowds and it was very relaxing. I hear weekends get crowded and busy.
reviews.title: Facilities are nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got back from the Rio Mar about a week ago. Everything was great. We did not really experience many of the troubles that others seemed to have.
reviews.title: Horrible in almost every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check in was great, we had a corner room facing the rain forest and the view was amazing. Ate at the sushi place on the grounds the first night. it was good, but expensive. Overall, we'd recommend leaving the grounds for meals since there are so many great local places very close.
reviews.title: Great Anniversary Trip

reviews.text: What a great place for families! Great pool, great beach. Good service pretty much everywhere at the hotel with only small issues here and there. Biggest drawback was the closed casino. The hotel will shuttle you to the nearby Gran Meila (15 to 20 minutes) but we're talking small "kill some time" casinos, not Las Vegas destinations, so even though I did this a couple of nights, it wasn't worth it. Especially not a good idea when the shuttle bus is full getting back to the Wyndham and I had to wait an hour for the next one. Just plan on skipping the casino experience (which was a big drawback because this was a factor in selecting this hotel in March and I never got any notice that it would close the day we arrived). As I write this review and rate this hotel, I have to look past this factor because it made me very angry.
reviews.title: Good place for familes; enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived, food prices blew us away, but food anywhere in PR isn't really cheap. When you figure in the convenience and extra safety factor, I would say this goes with the territory. Reasonably priced kids menu, but it's limited. That said, we didn't eat or drink ($10 a drink) at the hotel much as a result. We got a small fridge for our room and bought some drinks to keep around. Hard to figure that this was something they would do, but I have to not knock them for high drink prices if they make it easier to have my own. Strange business practice, but works for families.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: Staff was very nice to us almost all the time. Front desk and Concierge were pretty busy most of the time and didn't move quickly, but that was a result of staff working to take care of each person. They had printed directions to almost everything ready to hand out--very helpful. Valet parking was a little slow at peak times, but that should be expected. We learned to call ahead and they always had it ready to go. This was the nicest (most expensive) resort in which we have ever stayed, so we weren't the big tippers. We focused on being nice to the staff, even when we were tired, and tipping modestly. We were treated well in return.
reviews.title: Not the place to stay!

likes.disliked: — It was dirty with few places to eat

reviews.text: In terms of places to eat, we are apparently just too darn Americanized. Our favorite family places were Wing Hut (next to Pep Boys and North of Hwy 3 at the same turn where Walmart is to the south). Go figure, the standard Hibachi Grill which did a great job and entertained too; Don Pepe: combo mexican and local dishes just west of the turn on Hwy 3 into the resort and Antojitos, a local food menu right on the road from Hwy 3 to the resort. We also stopped quite a few times at the bakery on Hwy 3 which we found to be good food and excellent baked goods and sandwiches. Service was difficult and not well organized, but we still enjoyed it and met one of the owners who was a very nice lady.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Very Pricey

reviews.text: We organized most of our own off-resort activites to save a little money or tailor it to our needs. You do save money, but you also have a little more stress. All of our activities went well, but don't hesitate to ask for referrals, you'll probably get a good one and that's more reliable than a web site.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, horrible service
Nice Resort...Mediocre Food...Horrible Front Desk Service
reviews.text: My family and I (me + wife + 17 month son) just returned from a one-week stay at the Westin Rio Mar in April 2006. We were booked in a room on the second floor of the east wing of the hotel (the farthest wing from self parking and the conference center) with a reasonable view of El Yunque. The room was clean and of average size, but certainly nothing special. The public areas of the hotel were all very nice but it seemed like many of the restaurants and bars were closed while we were there. In fact, we couldn’t even find Cactus Jacks!?! I guess it closed down.

Front desk service at the hotel was absolutely terrible. It took 45 minutes to check in, 30 minutes of which we stood around waiting for the help at the front desk to return after “checking something out”. Room service was also terrible as was the service and food at the Marbella Restaurant. Fortunately, we had a rental car and minimized our time spent eating at the resort. On the plus side, David’s Cookies had great desserts and breakfast snacks and mojitos and other mixed drinks were always served up nicely from one bar to the next. The pools and beach are nice (see pictures) although if you’ve ever stayed at the Grand Wailea in Maui you’ll be exceptionally disappointed. There were numerous mistakes on our bill upon checkout, including three sets of charges for parking totaling more than $200! With this kind of service and lack of attention to detail this place will be a regular dump in five to ten years.
reviews.title: Exactly as you should expect
thank god
reviews.text: A visit to El Yunque is essential as it is right across the street from the resort. We also visited Old San Juan a few times and the Bacardi Rum Factory. Here are some suggestions on good restaurants if you don’t feel like being victimized by the junk served at the resort: (1) Tio Danny’s in Old San Juan for excellent Puerto Rican food, (2) Patio del Nispero at Hotel El Convento in Old San Juan, (3) Brass Cactus in Luquillo or on the way to San Juan for a family friendly bar and grill, and (4) Lolita’s on Route 3 in Luquillo for amazing Mexican food and strong margaritas. Avoid Victor’s Sea Food Place in Luquillo unless you enjoy fish and seafood deep-fried in month old grease served on a plate with live ants as a garnish.
I’ll be generous and give the Westin Rio Mar four stars since we secured an excellent rate (~$140/night) through my company’s travel agency. Paying considerably more than this would be a mistake.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: Spent a week here in April 2006; this was my second trip, as I was there for a week's vacation in the late 1990s as well. I can corroborate the various pros and cons listed in the reviews beneath this one, most of which are accurate and depend on one's perspective and optimism. In sum:

The location of the hotel is great, it's bit hidden and secluded which is great if you want to just get away. We spend two nights in Old San Juan and wanted to spend the last two nights more relax.

likes.liked: — location for a great getaway. excellent staff
likes.disliked: — standard looking rooms for such a beautiful looking hotel

reviews.text: We checked in and everything went very well..My husband was confused at the direction that was given to him regarding the location of the self park. (huh!!). It's just not that easy and simple given that was our fist time at this hotel.
reviews.title: Overall good, with a few kinks

reviews.text: I asked for an upgrade, since the hotel was not packed to capacity and we learned that 600 conventioneers checked out on the day we checked in. Yes we were given an upgrade to Ocean View. the view was gorgeous! Nothing else was great except for the view.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well.....the room was like a ice box, everything damp and freezing cold. We turned off the air conditioner, went out for dinner. Returned to the room and showered, shower drained clogged, bath towel filthy with hair.
reviews.title: Go somewhere else!

reviews.text: Just got back from the Westin Rio Mar on Saturday April 15th, we were there a week. The Hotel property itself is very nice and well kept. The staff that was there was very helpful (more on that in a minute). We had a Mountain View room and it was fine. We were there with our two children 4 & 9 and the room was fine for all of us. Now the downside All of the on-site restaurants are priced out of site for dinner and none better then Outback. We went to all of them Palio, The Grille Room, Aqua Luna. Our average dinner bill with one bottle of wine was over $250.00 every night. Please keep in mind the kids are eating a hot dog or macaroni and cheese. I read some of the reviews before I started to write this and some of the reviewers state that the hotel is "Only" 45 minutes from the Airport or Old San Juan. Well, to me that is a pretty long drive. Since the hotel is in the middle of nowhere you pretty much feel like a prisoner of the resort. If it rains while you are down there or if you need a break from the pool, boy are you in trouble. To break up our trip we decided to take a cab ride to Old San Juan..$180.00 round trip. Would have rented a car for the day but the Avis on site had no cars available. All in all there are plenty of places you can spend $4,000 to $5,000 for a weeks vacation and it is my opinion this is not the place. Oh getting back to my above mentioned staffing issues. You could never find a waiter around the pool area and on top of that each restaurant was closed at least 2 nights while we were down there because they did not have the proper staffing levels. I know I may sound a little tough on this place but don't only take my opinion we ended up meeting about 7 couples while we were down there and they all had the same opinion except for the family that golfed. This is what I would call a one and done...but if you can get it for real cheap go for three or four days only. Hope this helps...
reviews.title: Not At This Price

reviews.text: Absolutely delightful stay. Very nice beach. Children had great fun. Extremely clean, large and bright room. A very nice view of green forest. Staff very friendly. Excellent food. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wished I had stayed longer
A wonderful place in the Caribbean!!
reviews.text: We just returned from the Westin Rio Mar - were there from Apr 1 - 7. Like most, I was hesitant after reading the reviews, but decided to credit the positive ones - especially of late. We were not disappointed. We did not have a single problem. We did check a cooler as carry on luggage (we filled it with our snorkel gear, etc.) which came in handy - as we shopped at the little corner store and purchased pop, liquor, lunch meat, etc. We had most lunches and breakfasts on our beautiful patio. We only ate at Marabella, a couple of dinners and one breakfast - but our food was great, service was perfect. (Rio Mar Burger and Cuban were excellent!) Our check in was uneventful, and although we were staying on Starpoints - the clerk moved us from a ground floor room, to one higher up so we'd have a better view. it was spectacular. The beach was great, the waves were fabuous for boogie boarding (you can buy one for $15 in the gift shop - the day we left, we gave it to a family who was just arriving and they were thrilled!)

We spent two 1/2 days in the rainforest and it was great! If you hike down to the La Mina falls, wear your swimsuit - no place to change down there! No kidding about the Sierra Palm concession - the burgers there are to die for. There is a lot of rain, so when it is clear - head to the rainforest. We boogie boarded and snorkeld in the rain. Only when there was a big downpour did it slow us down! We also rented a car, great for running errands, getting around in the rainforest and finding a place to eat outside the hotel if you choose. (I disagree with all the raves about Rosa's in Fajardo - it was mediocre food, hard to find and expensive - but the rolls were good!) The highlight of our trip was the kayak trip through the mangrove swamp to the biolum bay - Mosquito Bay. You meet the guides and kayak right from the marina at Fajardo, it is an easy kayak trip and you get to jump in when you reach the middle of the bay. It is truly awe-inspiring to be swimming in a pitch black bay and be glowing green the whole time! Really - you don't want to miss this. Take the kids - our four year old loved it! The Westin Kids Club was great, staff there was kind and helpful. This is a typical Caribbean resort, drinks and food are expensive. Save where you can and don't sweat the rest... It is a beautiful place, the staff was wonderful, all the time, every where. We will definately return!
reviews.title: Would love to go back!

reviews.text: My husband and i just got back from a five day trip to the Westin Rio Mar on April 3rd....we absolutely loved it! The hotel is beautiful, and the pools and the beach were the highlight of our trip. I think the fact that we got an amazing deal on cheapcaribbean also made this vacation even better! We rented a car from Avis at the airport, which def was a smart thing to do, because we were able to go the local Kmart and stock up on things like cereal, and bottled water. Room service for breakfast was coming to about $40 for two people....we ended up saving a lot of money. We also did the ATV tour near the rainforest, which we highly recommend for anyone. Remember, bring sneakers because you will get very muddy! I would say if you have a car, contact the Carballi center directly rather than going through the hotel, who charges you $95 per person to rent the ATV's for 2.5 hours. The place is only a five min drive from the hotel and will give you a better deal if you go through them directly. I think they also do the bio bay tours for a much cheaper price (which we were unable to do because of the weather one night.)
reviews.title: Bedbugs!

reviews.text: I traveled to this hotel with 3 other girlfriends from June 20-22. This was my 3rd trip to Puerto Rico. I think this resort is a testament to Wyndham responding to the outcry re: level of service when this hotel was a Westin because the reviews since they have controlled it are like night and day! Our check-in was a breeze, though the fron't desk wasn't the most pleasant but they got better througout our stay. Our rooms were on the 6th floor, right next to each other which was what we requested and we could see the water from our room. We ate dinner 2 nights and breakfast one morning on the grounds and thought that it was much more reasonable than I expected. For dinner, we ate at Marbella and had a turkey burger with all the fixins for $13.00. Breakfast was $10 for eggs, toast, bacon and home fries. The buffet was $23. In addition, the waitstaff was EXCELLENT! We had the same waiter (Waldy) each night and he was very accomodating to whatever we needed. The resort is HUGE and it can be a little confusing getting around (I got lost in the hallway trying to get back to my room from the car!) but they have many convenient features: a coffee shop that sells breakfast breads, coffee, ice cream and David's Cookies; stores and carts within the resort; live music in the lobby bar every night. The beach was not very crowded and we had no problem getting assistance from the staff is setting up chairs and umbrellas for us. The pool was very nice - they have a "quiet pool" for those who don't want kids doing cannonballs in the water while you are reading - a nice feature. We went to the rainforest, which is a must since it is literally across the highway from the resort! It was very nice. We ate at one of the places within the rainforest and the prices were reasonable and the food was yummy. And you are only 20-30 minutes from San Juan. All in all, a great choice for a hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - Well Worth It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the the resort from June 17th - 23rd for our honeymoon and had a fabulous time! We had a partial ocean view room on the 7th floor, which meant that our balcony had view of both the rain forest and the ocean. The property was pretty empty during the week which was great for us. The food was expensive but tasty, our favorite was the new Aqua Luna cafe which let us bring our own wine with no corking charge. The hotel grounds were beautiful and the beach was basically deserted with nice swimming. However it can't compare to the beach at Culbrera -definitely worth a day trip! We took the bio bay tour through the hotel $160 for two and it was definitely worth it. We rented a car (a must) and did the rest of our sightseeing on our own - San Juan, rainforest, Culbrera. We also would recommend both Las Vegas (by the rainforest) and Richie's (at the top of the hill above the resort) for off site food. We requested a mini fridge when we arrived and were told that they were all out. However, the fridge arrived the following day with a fruit plate and bottle of wine as an apology. We found that all of the staff were very pleasant and quite helpful. We also took the shuttle to the casino for an evening and found it to be a nice trip out (especially since we won and needed a distraction from our snorkeling sunburn). Overall this was a great experience and we would definitely return. The resort is a great location to tour eastern PR, however if you are looking for lots of nightlife this isn't the place. But, if you are looking to see PR and enjoy a tropical vacation in a beautiful place you can't go wrong with this resort!
reviews.title: Loved the Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rio Mar for 6 days and 5 nights and had a great time. The moment that we checked in we were upgraded to an ocean suite. The beach was alot of fun because it had waves but it was never rough. There were always plenty of beach chairs and it was never crowded. You have beach side service where we ordered numerous drinks and lunch each day. The pool was also very nice with a small slide and a volleyball net for the kids and kids at heart. The golf course also looked very inviting although we didnt play. The entire staff at the hotel were friendly - we never experienced any rudeness as some of the reviewers mentioned. Each time we asked for suggestions on local eateries they were always very helpful. We found that almost EVERYONE spoke english to the point where it was a bit disappointing because we wanted to feel like we were very far away from home.
reviews.title: Fun in the Sun

likes.disliked: — Valet Parking was slow, entrance sign to the Registration Lobby was confusing, would have enjoyed more entertainment in the everning.

reviews.text: The Food at the Grille Restaurant in the hotel was our favorite - Best Prime RIb Ever and we are from New York which makes us big critics when it comes to food and service. If you are from a large city in the US like we are, prices will be more or less the same at all the restaurants. We thought all the restaurants in the hotel were very good. But renting a car is a must so you can go to the local eatieries and get a taste of real Puerto Rican Fare at inexpensive prices. The Yunque Rain Forest trip is a must do and it will give you a sense of accomplishment after hiking a mile up or down to the waterfalls and help rid some of the guilt from the thousands of calories that you have taken in so far with the Pina Coladas and Puerto Rican empanadas.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel, beautiful rooms and great food
likes.disliked: — Not a lot to do on the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino is closed until October and there wasnt any nightlife except the lobby bar which had live music. Dont bother going to the casino that they shuttle you to. Take a drive to El San Juan Hotel in San Juan..it is well worth the trip. The drive is about 30 minutes on rt 66 to 26 and it is a great place to go for gambling, lounging and dancing...all right in the lobby! It was action packed and a great place to visit and win some money but we were glad to return to our hotel at 430 am to serenity and relaxation.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
Extravagantly Wonderful
reviews.text: Sorry that this review took so long on this marvelous resort. I traveled to the resort with my wife and 3 kids (15,13,10). This resort lived up to all the expectations I had and more. We first arrived on Sunday July 24th at the San Juan Airport. At the baggage claim, we were greeted by a resort representative. We happened to arrive on the day they were working on the highway so a 30 minute drive turned into an hour and 30 minute ride, but the ride was scenic with the mountains and all. We arrived at the resort at 1:00 p.m. We went to check-in and they said our room would be ready in 20 minutes, which was great because standard check-in time was 3:30 p.m. When we arrived in our two bedroom beachfront suite our luggage was already placed nicely in the living room. Our suite was located on the first floor which was convient. It consisted of 2 king sized beds and 2 queens in the living room. The myth about the bug beds is not true the hotel lived up to its heavenly bed with 200 thread egyptian cotton sheets. I recommend the all-inclusive plan which is $100.00 per a person per night because the resorts 6 restaurants might get pricey. Our tripped sadly ended Friday July 29th after 5 fabulous nights. I am a big time business man and have stayed nothing less than the best. I have stayed at the Atlantis Resort in the Bahamas, Sandals, Sun Village Beach Resort and other 5 star resorts in Hawaii, St Thomas, St. Martin, Bermuda , and more this is in the top 3. The only complaint was that you needed to reserve a beach or pool chair by 10:30 because if you didn't you would be out of luck, same with the towels.

As others have noted, I was extremely anxious about this resort after all the negative reviews here. We have traveled extensively especially in the Caribbean and we settled on this location because of the length of our stay (5 days) and easy flights. I'm pleased to say our stay was great! Was it perfect? No, but very few Caribbean resorts are outside of the Four Seasons at Nevis and Caneel Bay in St. John. This resort is extremely large. We were there over Easter week and it was completely full. Even with that, every service person we encountered had a big smile and tried to be as helpful as possible. Chairs were scarce around the pool areas, but on demand at the beach. My kids had a good time because of all the activities (my sons are 11 and 12). They have a nice gameroom and frequently showed movies at the pool at night with soft drinks and popcorn. My youngest especially loved the nightly bonfire and s'mores!! There is a new "highway" from the airport (66) so the drive is now under 30 minutes. If you go, try "King's Seafood" near Fajardo. I recommend this resort highly especially if you have a family!
reviews.title: Great experience!
Our family Loved it!
reviews.text: We took our 18 month old daughter to the Westin for 7 nights and had a great time! Lots of babies and kids this week. The staff was very friendly and resort always clean. We thought we were getting a mt. view and they gave us the ground floor garden/ocean view which was awesome, easy access to pool area and high ceilings.

reviews.title: Beautiful resort: Great for families but not so good for couples
reviews.text: The heavenly cribs were great compared to other hotel cribs. The food was expensive but good, all resorts have expensive food, when you go to a hotel like this it is expected. The food takes a long time to get to you by the pool but you are on vacation, relax and order a half hour before you want to eat. The beach was wonderful as well as the pools and baby pool. All the kids looked like they were having a great time.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable vacation!!!
reviews.text: Every night there was a bonfire with free smores and bottled water. The only negative about the trip was the 45 minute long bus ride to the hotel but the hotel bus was very comfortable. We didn't leave the hotel all week, if you are looking for a very relaxing vacation at a classy place this is the hotel for you. The resort is gorgeous and we have stayed at some top notch hotels. We will go back to this hotel!

reviews.title: Exceptional service in paradise

reviews.text: When we arrived at the resort we were greeted by two smiling bellmen who helped us with our luggage. Check-in was a breeze 10 minutes at the most. We requested our room to be on the 6th or 7th flloor overlooking the El YunQue rainforest. If you do get a resortview instead of oceanview which I recomend it will save you money and actually it is more impressive than the ocean view, stay on the 6 or 7th floor. Our room was in pristine condtion with two Heavenly beds, terracotta tile floors, the room has a blow-dryer in it that is better than the one I have at home, a safe was in our room as well, along with toiletries from Bath and Body Works, bottled water was given to us daily (San Pelligrino) there was supposed to be a charge for this type of bottled water but our maid gave it to us for free. The beaches here at the resort are to die for. Super clean and smooth
