reviews.title: Nice rooms but constant construction ruined beach/pool time

likes.liked: — Comfy room at a great price
likes.disliked: — construction noise prevented us from enjoying beach and pool

reviews.text: I read some reviews of the Westin that are pretty poor, and I just don't get it. I had the most glorious time at the Westin (now the Wyndham). My new husband and I planned our wedding at the Rio Mar. I do not have a single complaint. I had to admit that after reading some reviews, I was concerned about how the customer service would be. The customer service was a 10!!!! I was asked if I needed help whenever I wasn't even looking for help. The rooms are comfortable. And, if you do not have an ocean view or would rather save your pennies, the next best thing is the view of the Rain Forest. Every part of the resort property was absolutely breathtaking. The pictures on its website do not do the place justice. The beach and ocean are beautiful. The pool area is clean and relaxing. We had 80 friends and family at the hotel with us, and everyone had a glorious time. Yes, it is expensive, but it is expected at a vacation resort. Frozen drinks are $10, but you can get the local Medalla beer for $4. Dinners range from $14 to $50. You can do it pretty cheap if you wanted to. Rent a car for the day, go to the grocery and stock up on snacks, sandwiches, water and liqour. Save your money for dinner. For breakfast you can go to the coffee shop for $4 ham and cheese croissants. For lunch grab a foot long hot dog for $7. For dinner you can sit at the Bistro bar and have a pizza for $14. Depending on how adventerous you are, a rental car would be advisable, but not necessary. We only rented a car one day and went to the rain forest and Old San Juan. We were content the rest of the time just hanging out at the beach and relaxing. The iguanas add entertainment. Word of warning, the casino closed the day we left. Rumor is that it will be closed until October for rennovations. I do not have a bad thing to say about the Westin. iIcould not have asked for a more perfect vacation with family and friends, wedding or honeymoon. Enjoy!!!
reviews.title: An Absolute Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Rio Mar for my honeymoon and found it a pleasant and relaxing stay. Upon arrival the room we had booked was not available and we were put in a room with two double beds. This was a bad beginning but the staff quickly made up for it by transferring us to a ocean front king room. The room was clean and fairly big. The pool was beautiful as well as the beach was very clean and secluded. We went on a few excursions and found them very easy to book and affordable.
reviews.title: Great relaxing vacation

reviews.text: My only complaints are the prices of food and drinks at the hotel were really expensive. Also, cab prices were very expensive as well, making it difficult to leave the hotel for cheaper food. Also, the resort was very 45 minutes from San Juan, making it difficult to enjoy San Juan nightlife which we had heard was excellent.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds....not much activity

reviews.text: Overall, our stay was great! I would suggest it for couples and especially families because the pool has a slide and was very conducive for children.
reviews.title: Inept management and service

reviews.text: We stayed at the Rio Mar from May 31st thru June 2nd. The property is immense and for as large as it is there is actually very little to do other than golfing and swimming.
reviews.title: Just ok.

likes.liked: — great beach with lots of sun beds
likes.disliked: — food and drinks were way too expensive

reviews.text: A group of five middle age golfers/fishermen/general tourists, stayed for 4 days in mid-March. We found the hotel to be excellent. Clean, staff very accomodating and registration easy. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants because we wanted to sample the local restaurants and were put off in advance by some negative reviews regarding wait times and expense of the Hotel's restaurants.
reviews.title: Good Time at a Nice place

likes.disliked: — Limited opportunities for activities without rental car

reviews.text: We also took advantage of the local grocery store for snacks, beer and rum. This enabled us to hang out at the beach/pool in the evening and relax and enjoy the beautiful weather and attractive surroundings.
reviews.title: Stay Away!!!!!
Great Vacation
reviews.text: We rented a car at the hotel which was more expensive than if we had arranged it in advance from the airport but we enjoyed getting out to fish/shop and see the Rain Forest. The golfers took advantage of twilight fees at 2:00 and that was a good choice. The Ocean Course has only a single ocean hole. The River Course is more aptly named and a bit more challenging.

reviews.title: Loved the Westin
reviews.text: In summary, we are a low key, low maintenance group who had a terrific time and would recommend this hotel and the people of Puerto Rico highly.

reviews.title: Dirty, a ripoff, never go again
reviews.text: They list 8 restaurants on their website...but most were Not Open (I think that that's a pretty important little detail, don't you?)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Aug 14-18, 2008. Going in I wasn't sure what to expect. I had read both good and bad reviews on the hotel. So, we got there and the rental car experience (airport) was a little messy but we made it down Rt 3 to the Rio Mar. The hotel and grounds are nice. Two golf courses. The lobby area is pleasant. There is a bar in this general area, that gets croweded with adults at night (esp weekends). There is also a small casino at the hotel. The Concierge was helpful in finding local restaurants. Wireless internet is available in the lobby area. There are 4 computers for use by all in the lobby area too.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay at the Rio Mar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a Jr Suite, which my wife enjoyed. I did take the advice from a review on this site to join the Wyndham rewards program before we went. The upgraded room was nice. Terry robes in the closet, flat panel TV, King size bed, large sitting area. We even received a bottle of wine with cheese and crackers. The Bed was turned down every night of our 5 day stay. The bathroom was clean and up to date (my pet peeve). The pools were nice. An adult only pool and others, plus a slide. The beach is very close. We enjoyed a nice long walk. The sand is not clean but its not dirty with trash. Just some minor things that wash in from the ocean- small pieces of wood, etc. It is a public beach, that is occupied by resort guests mostly. There are chairs and umbrellas available to use. There is security to get into and out of the resort. The weekend use, on the beach, was higher than weekdays.
reviews.title: Nice Resort, Pretty Grounds, Overall Pretty Good

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel, large bathrooms, a lot of onsite convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate breakfast at Marbella's one time (at hotel). Price was 20.00 pp. It was good with a large selection. We also ate at Richie's, LaParella's, and the restaurant on the corner of Rt 3, just down from the resort. The prices at local places are anywhere from $10-$15 pp. The food good and the portions large. The dining areas are all outside, so dont expect AC while dining at local places. I recommend Richie's for the view from the mountain. There is also all the regular fast food places in Loquillo and Fajardo, just east on Rt 3. We visited the large mall in San Juan and the outlet stores at Rt 3 & 66.
reviews.title: Treated us like we were one of their family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visit the rain forest. It was a good day. You will need time to enjoy everything and hike to the larger waterfall, if you want. You can drive the entire thing and get out to walk certain areas- falls, sight towers. Old San Juan was good. Lots of history. Have to go back and finish that tour.
reviews.title: Just Back From the Rio Mar

reviews.text: One drawback- not easy to access water sport activities. Were given a sheet and prices at concierge but never received a return call. Oh, and if you plan to do a lot, outside the resort, sharpen up on the Spanish. All traffic signs are in Spanish. I do recommend having a car if staying here. Valet parking is $20 a day and self is $15 per day. We used valet just for convenience. There were other events at the hotel which made self parking a little crowded.
reviews.title: There is bad, then there is the Wyndham!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well this hotel wasnt bad for the price. Let me explain. I am one who goes to timeshare presentations, because they offer you a nice trip for a low price. Now for 5 days I paid $495. When I went to our timeshare presentation, the person said we had a great deal coming here because the usual rate for the room we were in was $418 a nite!!!! WOW. I would have been mad if I paid that amount for the room, but since mine come out to about $100 per nite, I was very happy.
reviews.title: Pretty good for the price!!!!

likes.liked: — Clean room, Close to beach, close to highway, good food and drinks

reviews.title: Do not rent from Resort Villa Rentals!
reviews.text: PROS: The hotel is big. Huge. Emormous. We had a rental car and it takes about 3-4 to drive out to the main road from the parking lot. If you golf this is a dream resort. We went for a get -away just to relax, and we did. We got an Ocean Suite after check-in(I didnt have to bribe or prompt anyone either). The room was very nice and clean. Flatscreen, internet ready and a beautiful! view of the pool and ocean. The breeze was great. Nice little balcony to hang out on. The pool is big and clean and a joy to swim in. It has many restaurants, we only ate at one. The Marbella was nice, we only ate breakfast there. The buffet was $20 pp, but it came w/ everything. Omelet station, pastrys, fruit--you name it. So I guess the price wasnt too bad. Overall, the Rio Mar wasnt too bad. I have stayed in better hotels, but this was a nice one to hang out in if you are with the family. On Saturday nite, the lobby is decked out in candles, there was a guy playing guitar and later on a little Spanish band played while the people danced. That was cool to see.

CONS: Ok the bad. Even though the hotel decor was nice, you could see where the exterior needs touching up. This building seems like it has been here for a while. While paint isnt falling off, it could use renovation. Also, the beach is DIRTY! Although the beach is off the property and public, you would think since guests were there you would clean it up. Full of cig butts, straws, cups, and other small things. I had to watch my step. But the sand is soft and water clear. There are a few vendors on the beach where you can rent a kayak or other sports, but not too many water sports at the resort. You have to go off site and pay like $80-100 for those. As with hotels everything is double in price, whether its bagels, muffins or water. The drinks are small and cost $10(they are good though). Two big things I hated was parking. $20 per day for valet, $15 for self park. Fortunately for me the lot was full for self park, so their other lot the gate didnt work, so most of the trip I didnt pay for parking. I think I paid only one day. Also, you know when you check in they place a hold on your credit card for incenditals. Usually 2-300 bucks right? These jokers placed $900 hold on mine!!! They said there system was set up that way, they cant help it. I was [-] because 1. No one told me that at check-in, 2. Who places almost a $1000 block on people's credit card? Between that and the car rental, I had $14 credit left. Fortunately, I had some more cash I could have used.
reviews.title: Loved the Rio Mar Resort

likes.liked: — The comfortable beds, cleanliness, beauty of the hotel
likes.disliked: — The price of the food, beaverages.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So all in all a nice vacation. It is an expensive resort, so bring some cash if you want to eat/drink there. I would suggest renting a car, becuase its far from the airport, and if you want to go off the property, you'll need it, unless you are a professional hiker. They charge for transportation everywhere, so even though parking is $15 bucks, I would pay for convenience. All the major car rentals are off-site from the airport, so just reserve on-line and take a shuttle there. The El Yunque rainforest is very close, so drive there and its free. Also Richie's restaurant is nice, good food at a restaurant overlooking the mountains. Very romantic, about a 5min drive from the hotel.
reviews.title: Standard Big Resort with Exceptional Beach

likes.disliked: — Ordinary looking rooms, Standard continental cuisine in restaurants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented an Ocean Villa from Resort Villa Rentals. During our stay we had a group enter our condo with a key claiming to have rented the same condo, repair men in our condo 5 of 7 days until the concierge finally told us the problem would not be fixed until after we left, broken air conditioners, broken freezer, no washcloths, and numerous other smaller problems. Xavier and Beby would not return our phone calls or emails. I have been unable to reach them since we have returned home. Security is deplorable and this company is completely unresponsive to problems. I expected basic appliances to be functioning (i.e. the refrigerator and freezer) but they were not. I highly recommend visiting Puerto Rico but DO NOT rent from Resort Villa Rentals.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin Rio Mar for 5 days. You definitely need to rent a car to get there because transportation by taxi ($60-70) or by shuttle service is too expensive. Getting to the resort was not a problem--go by Rt 66, make a right at Belz Factory Outlet onto Rt 3 and you'll see the sign for the Westin on the left. However, finding the main building in the resort was difficult, especially at night. We saw all the signs telling us, "Caution: Iguana Crossing" but no clear sign directing us to the hotel. Eventually we hit a deadend and a staff member helped us out.
reviews.title: Wary at first, but great resort

reviews.text: Check-in: Very fast, very smooth, and very patient to answer all our questions. We also had a fridge request (no extra charge) and that was brought to our room in 10 min. Self Parking is very efficient but pricey $10/day.
reviews.title: Some issues, but pleasant overall...
A beautiful resort with a wonderful staff!
reviews.text: Room: The first thing we did was check for bedbugs after all the reviews we read about that. We were in total paranoia, but we were lucky and there were no bugs in our beds. We were on the first floor...very high ceilings. Standard room, no frills, nice balcony...comfortable. Housekeeping wasn't always reliable. There were days when we didn't get face towels, then the next we didn't get new soap. We literally walked up to the cart and picked it up ourselves because they never delivered it to our room even after we called.

Grounds: Very beautifully kept. The maintenance starts early and everything is very organized. There were plenty of towels, pool balls, lounge chairs with umbrellas around the pool. The beach is "eh", not the golden sand or clear blue water you imagine of the caribbean but it's still nicely kept. there are cabanas and plenty of lounge chairs there too. They have 2-3 jet skis, kayaks..but all for a price ($60 jet ski for 1/2 hour).
reviews.title: Beautiful beach setting, but the rooms and amenities are just ok

reviews.text: they have activities planned everyday that are listed on a bulletin board in the lobby and outside area by the pool (power walk, iguana feeding, dancing). the casino is not very large but it's still fun to just wander around. they have a very large conference room...was not able to see inside, but we did see the outside grounds set up for a wedding. The grass in that area was extremely brown, not exactly pretty. Oh..bugs galore...must wear bug spray everywhere you go.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I just came back from my vacation in Puerto Rico. June 29th through July 8. We stayed at 3 different hotels so we could explore the whole island and ALL 3 hotels were great because of using trip advisor. ALWAYS use trip advisor even if hotels.com gives it 5 star. My sister, friends and I stayed at Lazy Parrot, Wyndhem Rio Mar Resort (formerly the westin rio mar) and Coral Princess. We stayed at this hotel for one night since we want to go to the rainforest and do some things on the east side of Puerto Rico. We got a nice room for $129 a night since we are an "Entertainment" member. Its a book called The Entertainment Book with coupons for hotels and car rentals. We could have gotten a suite for the same price but they were all booked (july 4th). Alot of the reviews said that place is secluded. They made it seem it was in the middle of nowhere. Its off the busy highway and there are some restuarants that are 5 minutes away. Though you do have to travel up a road where there are nothing but trees and some houses but there are so much to do at Rio Mar, you really wouldn't want to leave anyway. There are shops that sell name brand stuff like clothes, jeans swimsuits, Guess purses. There was a casino but its being remodeled and will open up in Oct 2007. I peeked inside and its gonna be nice. There is a game room/arcade for the kids that stays opened either all night or til 2am. The rooms you gotta know are excellent. Absolutely great and the BEACH.....we didn't want to leave. In puerto rico the sun is up at 5:30am. The water was so calm and BLUE!!!!!! This was the first hotel I've been to where the internet pix was an exact replica of how the hotel really was. That resort looked so FAKE! Everything was so BEAUTIFUL and green and blue...we were impressed. You will think that my pictures were from the hotels website. The food is pricey. I only had breakfast there. They have this card in the room where they will bring breakfast to your room. You just circle what you want and what time you want it. I don't recommend doing this because, they charge for delivery and plus these taxes and stuff. I almost did it but I went to the restuarant downtairs and it was the same food and a dollar or two cheaper. Breakfast, I had 2 eggs, toast, sausage and orange juice and my total was about $15. It was good though. I definitely would like to come back here. The staff was very nice and some were cute too =)!!!!!!
reviews.title: LOVED RIO MAR!!! STAY HERE!!!

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING! Lounging at beach and pool

reviews.text: Overall I was very pleased with the Wyndham Rio Mar. I was part of a larger group. It was my husband's family reunion. There were 23 of us in total including children, two of which were under 2 years old. We all rented three of the 3-bedroom golf villas. I read many of the reviews on this site and because I got to see three different villas I do understand why there are different opinions. Of the three villas our group rented, one was fabulous (luckily, this was the one I was in), one was very nice, and one was not nice. I understand that each is owned privately so each is decorated and cared for differently. However, these were not cheap and the one villa was unacceptable for the price we paid. That one was Villa Naranja. It really needs to be nicer. It was practically bare and there were light bulbs without any fixtures. Just bare light bulbs. Not worth the price. However, Villa Chaly and Villa Rio were fantastic. Villa Rio was the best. If you go try to request it. I rented the villas through The Clusters.com. They were great. Totally helpful. Especially Xavier. He's awesome. Ok, now for the resort. It was very nice though we didn't spend a whole lot of time inside the main building. There was a bunch of construction going on past the main building. I guess just past where the ocean villas were. It was unattractive but the only reason we drove by it was because we drove past the main building by accident. You can't see it from the pool or beach as far as I know. Maybe from the Ocean VIllas though. We ate in the casual restaurant one night and were pleased. But I have to say I don't think Puerto Rican food is all that great to begin with so I wasn't expecting much. The golf villas are quite a ways away from the resort pool and beach. But each villa had use of a golf cart which made it fine. Especially for the kids. They loved the carts. We even found a free place to park a car (near the playground at the pool). The beach was nice though we spent most of our time at the pool. It was pretty windy most of the time we were there so they wouldn't allow umbrellas on the beach and we needed them for the babies. The food and drinks at the pool are ridiculously expensive. Bring a small cooler and bring your own. So that's it. Would I go back? Only if we did another family reunion there - my husband's family is Puerto Rican. Though this has nothing to do with the resort. I just think there are much nicer places than Puerto Rico. Aside from the resorts and more affluent areas near the resorts it seems to be all strip malls and high rise condos. With the exception of Old San Juan which should not be missed.
reviews.title: Please with Rio Mar

reviews.text: We stayed on the first weekend of the changeover to Wyndham. Our special Wyndham package discount was handled well and was a great savings. The hotel facilities were excellent. The room was more than adequate in size for our family of 4 (kids age 18 & 15). I'm not sure why anyone would think the pool or beach were not nice. We took jet ski's out and had a great time with no one else in sight. It compares favorably with most beach resorts.
reviews.title: great trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location to the Rain Forest and the bio bay trips. The tips mentioned by other travelers helped as we parked in the employee lot and saved. The bakery at the entrance is indeed terrific and reasonably priced. We were prepared from other reviews that the food was expensive and everyone is correct. We also had the wonderful donuts and cookies for breakfast. I can't help but think that if they lowered the price of drinks at the pool & food cost that they would sell much more. We ate out at local restaurants which were all terrific.
reviews.title: Loved our 5 days at the Rio Mar

likes.disliked: — Limited party night-life. Casino was closed for renovations (but it will be nice when it opens)

reviews.text: We played golf at twilight rates and had course to ourselves. Again we think due to cost. for 4 the price was over $300.
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.text: This is older, but comfortable resort. It's also in the middle of no-where, except entering north side of the rain forest. The trips to old San Juan are long and a tiring drive, likewise visiting the prettier east side of the islaind is 3-5 hours each way. The hotel's management is entirely absent, for example: 4 hours of 2-stroke leaf blowers Monday around the pools, concrete drills starting at 8am on the relandscaping project Thursday morning, half dozen kids screaming in the pool at 1-2 am in the morning two different nights, (really), they lost our car, the staff directed us to hotel restaurants that were closed, the casino is closed - for months, the beach and pool equipment isn't cleaned, PA system blasting music all night into the courtyeard because someone "forgot" to turn it off when the bar closed, and on and on. You can have a very comfortable and enjoyable stay, but it is one of the worst run resorts I've visited. Watch out if your room is by the pools, although the signs say they close at 8pm, they are 24/7 and that means big fun between 11-3am to alot of people. I would not go back.
reviews.title: A Old Time Resort with No Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wyndham Rio Mar is located on a lush tropical setting. Although the beach in front of the hotel is choppy you can walk to the west of the hotel and find spots where the beach is very nice.
reviews.title: Loved Rio Mar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had a very nice relaxed stay and would definitely go back. We had lunch at Richie's restaurant, very close to the hotel, and enjoyed a spectacular view.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel-- little pricey though...
Great vacation spot
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in an awesome location. I didn't want a hotel right next to the airport in San Juan (which is where most of the hotels are located) and was glad to have chosen the Rio Mar--it's about 19 miles from the airport and away from the majority of traffic. On the way in, we took what the locals consider "a highway," but what most people would consider a long stretch of road with tons of stoplights. You may want to take their tollroad, which costs $1.50 and saves you about 20 minutes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very spacious and so are the rooms. We were upgraded from "resort view" to "ocean view" upon check-in and the views didn't disappoint. You're right there on the beach and you have a nice little patio area.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort by the beach

reviews.text: I just returned from a stay at this resort and found it to be wonderful! The rooms were nice, the staff attentive, the beach, pools and weather were amazing! The golf was great! The resort was VERY family friendly with so many great things for the kids to do.
reviews.title: The place was wonderful . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, yes - the food and drinks were overpriced, but that is to be expected at a resort like this, in my opinion.
reviews.title: Typical beach resort

likes.disliked: — Crowds, slow service, many added costs

reviews.text: I attended a yoga class poolside and received a private one hour lesson because I was the only one who showed up. The instructer was awesome and what an incredible opportunity to learn about yoga.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: After looking at some of the previous entries, I think there are some people who did not research their vacation plans very well and who are just looking for something to complain about.
reviews.title: We really enjoy this resort!

reviews.text: The place was wonderful and I would recommend it to my friends and family.
reviews.title: Great Family Trip!!!

likes.disliked: — far from San Juan, no puerto rican influence

reviews.text: We st;ayed at the Wyndham for 6 nights with a business meeting. The setting is absolutely beautiful. Great pool, and a beautiful beach area. We brought 3 children, ages 8. 11, and 17. They loved the pools. Our 17 year old was a little bored, not much to do for his age. It is a ways away from everything else. The younger kids loved it. They would have swam in the pools, and played in the ocean all day. The room was okay, nothing special, rather small. The airconditioner was very noisy. The staff and service was good. Food is very expensive.
reviews.title: Beatiful Setting

reviews.text: We stayed at the Rio Mar Beach Resort & Spa on a business/vacation trip. Service in the hotel and restaurants was awlful. Food selection was very limited and overpriced. Maid service was scarce. Rooms were dirty from the dust on the furniture, dirty showers, dust bunnies on the floors and gritty tile floors. Bed linens were not changed on a daily basis, AC was lowered or turned off in the evening hours by the hotel I guess to conserve electricity. Chasing down shower supplies and laundry bags in the halls from the chamber maids. We had a load of laundry washed, no dry cleaning, 25 items mostly socks and underwear washed. $97.00 for one load of laundry that propably got washed in a massive washer along with all the other laundry. We asked to use a washer and dryer , there are none on the property . Transportation costs were staggering. The adult pool had white slimy scum floating all around the edge of the pool,Pool deck was not kept clean. One of the barmaids spilled a drink off her tray onto the pool deck and it sat there all day . No one even bothered to clean it up. Unfortunately it was in front of our $150 cabana . So we had to walk around it all day . I was very dissappointed in this hotel, we usually stay at the Marriott properties. I will not be booking anymore Wyndham properties, that is for sure....
reviews.title: Think Twice Before Booking Rio Mar Beach Resort & Spa
Very Not Great
reviews.text: we left Old San Juan looking for a relaxing time at the beach. What we found was nothing special at the Rio Mar. Really, this hotel could be anywhere in the US; there's no Puerto Rican personality at all, yet you feel a little like you're in Europe, because your dollar doesn't go very far . If you're looking for a vacation experience that doesn't involve hundreds of insurance salespeople from Nebraska having a meeting , or dozens of loud children in the restaurants, I suggest staying in a more sophisticated location in Old San Juan. This place absolutely lacks soul -- drab colors, huge lobbies that make you feel like you're waiting for an Amtrak and architecture that can only be described as suburban mallesque. The worst is the food. If you love Applebees and Red Lobster, even you will be extremely disappointed. We were there four nights and did not have even one above average meal--most were really terrible. On an island known for its incredible coffee, the stuff at this hotel is served luke warm and weak as tea. Its hot food is cold; its salad greens are brown and there's no local specialties on the menu (unless you think tuna wraps and chicken wings are Puerto Rican). At night, instead of people drifting outside to walk along the ocean or talk by the pool, the in-house casino ramps up and sucks all of the previously mentioned sales people in. If you want a bland beach resort, go to Ft. Lauderdale. If you're pretending to expose your children to an exotic environment without risk, go to Epcot Center. If you want to experience the great food, wonderful sights, and gracious people of Puerto Rico, stay in Old San Juan.

If you like properties that are in deep need of a refurbishment head straight for this "resort". For example, carpets are worn, walls need painting and linens tattered. I was shocked by the sad shape of the ocean front room we occupied. To begin with, our toilet did not flush they tried to repair it (we had to use the end of our hairbrush to flush it) we asked to be moved and was told they had no other ocean front room available. Our mini bar was filled with mold and every time the air conditioner clicked on it sounded as if the door was being slammed. The poor physical shape of the hotel was matched by the inattentive, unaccommodating front desk staff. I could go on and on.
reviews.title: stay away

reviews.text: We are still at the resort as I write this. We have room overlooking the resorts larger pool. The bass heavy music at the pool is blaring and the young children are screaming. If you are deaf this will be a quiet retreat for you. Otherwise bring earplugs. The food is not bad, the staff is pleasant and the grounds are very manicured. We both had a massage and rated it as good. I am not saying this is a bad resort I am just saying it is just too noisy for us. Some people here are having a great time. We will not be back.
reviews.title: no peace at this resort
Itching to get home!
reviews.text: Wyndham Rio Mar in El Yunque Rainforest, Puerto RIco was one of the most beautiful and tranquil resorts that I have ever been to. Unfortunately, our 4 day trip ended not a minute too soon, as the bedbugs reigned supreme at the resort and quite frankly, sent us packing! Loved the resort, hated getting eaten alive!

Just got back from five days at the Wyndham and was pleasantly surprised, given some of the reviews on this site. The hotel is in great shape, grounds are beautiful, most of the staff I dealt with couretous and competent and overall, it is a very nice resort. True, food prices are high but you would find that to be the case at most other resorts like this one.Overall, quality was pretty good at all the restaurants -- Grille Room, Palio, Asian, Marbellas - especially like the beach food for its convenience and setting. Recommend this resort if what you want is a relaxing trip reading at the beach, sunning and just plain lying around, rent a car -- visit the local beaches and tastes at Luquillo - just 10 minutes away. The El Yunque rainforest hike was fun too. If you know what to expect, you won't be disappointed --might be pleasantly surprised like me. this is a nice place to spend a few days!
reviews.title: I liked it!

reviews.text: I arrived early with my wife for a conference the first week of December. We enjoyed the hotel -- lovely facility and grounds, nice comfortable rooms, sufficient work out facility. We're not big "beach resort" people and were glad we rented a car in San Juan (although driving in Puerto Rico traffic is not for the timid!).
reviews.title: Nice, but pricey. Much preferred our time in San Juan

likes.liked: — Very nice rooms and some lovely common areas
likes.disliked: — The room rate was a bargain, but other parts (fees, food prices) felt like robbery!

reviews.text: Food: Count me with the reviewers who say that pricing was brutal. $25 for the breakfast buffet (and good luck getting out for under $20 per person ordering off the menu)? $90 for unsatisfying dinner for two at the Japanese place? $130 for decent (but nothing special) Italian cuisine at Palio? Eesh! They make it hard not to spend money. The last morning we grabbed breakfast at the bakery/hole-in-the-wall at the entrance road/Route 3 and got a ton of food for under $10. Wish we'd seen it sooner . . . My wife would not have been comfortable journeying into the five-minute drive away part of Rio Grande, though, so I'm not sure what options are there. Bargain eating on site? The casual place at the golf club was good and resembled non-resort prices. The ice cream/sweets kiosk was a good deal and tasty, but they closed it our last day to re-open it as something else.
reviews.title: Simply Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nickel and dime: $14 bell hop fee that we learned of upon getting our bill at the end. Tip for housekeeping? Already included. Learned about THAT one at check out, too. $15/day to self-park . . .
reviews.title: Nice Resort, Average Experience

aka: Rio Mar Beach Resort And Spa, a Wyndham Grand Resort
description: Nestled between the Atlantic Ocean and the Caribbean National Forest, The Westin Rio Mar Beach Golf Resort & Spa in Puerto Rico presents the ultimate Caribbean resort experience! This luxurious resort is secluded on a 500-acre estate framed by lush green mountains and a mile of palm-lined beach. From the moment you arrive, you are reminded that The Westin Rio Mar Beach sets the world's standards for hospitality service. Richly appointed tropical luxury makes each guest room a welcome, private haven. Spectacular views of the sapphire blue Atlantic or the majestic El Yunque, the Caribbean National Forest, complement the island-styled décor in our 600 guest rooms and suites, all featuring Westin’s renowned Heavenly Beds® and Heavenly Baths®. Rich, natural woods, Italian tile, plush fabrics and preferred amenities surround each guest with privileged comfort. A beachfront paradise for recreation, the resort offers an array of pleasures from championship golf and extensive watersports to night-time excitement at the Rio Mar Casino. Amenities include two beachfront pools, two world-class golf courses, the exclusive Mandara Spa with fitness center, 11 Har-Tru tennis courts, water sports center, scuba diving, bicycling and a variety of specialty shops and boutiques.
